I have 1K hours on the PS4 and then I switched to the PC version for the graphics and performance, I had to buy everything all over again and that in itself shows how much I love this game.

Dead By Daylight can be a stressful but incredibly fun game and your attitude determines if you'll be playing it for more than once. While this game is fun there are a lot of imbalances on both the Killer and Survivor side which enables people to take advantage of the game mechanics and do some really mean things, your attitude towards this is important. If you can brush it off and laugh, if you can accept that you need to invest time so that you can get better and the only one who can get you through each match is yourself then you'll do fine and I say come on in and join the fun! :D   But if you get angry easy and can't think out of box or get triggered by bullies then you won't enjoy this game and I will say move on. This game is always getting updates and is very fun to play both sides and I recommend it highly but just know that this game has its flaws and the Devs can't or wont, we don't know, fix them fast enough.

Jogo bom, porém abandonado.

The atmosphere of the game is fantastic. The genre is new and fresh, and still pretty much the only one of its kind. It allows for many different play styles and tactics. This game is very well supported, and constantly coming out with new, very high quality content.

The downsides are all player based. You still have trolls who will work to throw the game then quit, or who will work with the killer to ruin the game, you have rage quitters, afkers, and so forth, but they are all reportable offenses, though I don't know what kind of discipline, if any, ever comes from it.

Altogether, very worth.

If you enjoy being scared or fear itself, this is the game for you.

So, came back to the game again and got to say, I'm in love with the changes that so many reviewers lately have been complaining about, the increased vision especially as a survivor main allows me to bait and switch killers and play this game in a much more dynamic way, killer as well of course it makes the big brain a lot more fun to pull off
Secondly, the UI and trackers are a godsend, allowing you to see hook #'s when attempting to go for 12 hook games and such, one less thing to think about, or you can decide how important it is to save a specific person based of their hooks, with the tally right in your face!
As for the hitboxes, this might be an unpopular opinion since i left for a few months, but they feel better then they ever have on both killer and survivor, and the lack of 360 being as viable an option now with the weird blur gone when survivors did it, all of this makes the game incredibly intuitive for me
of course there's always going to be weird hits in updates for dbd, we all know that, it's an online server based game, but at least it's not connected to the killers lag switch anymore!

Por outro lado,  é inegável que a quantidade de bugs no jogo beira o inaceitável. Eu relevo os bugs porquê realmente o jogo é muito divertido. Não encontrava um jogo que me prende como Dead by Daylight há anos.
